==German== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|de|gmh|willekomen}}, from {{inh|de|goh|willechomen}}, from {{inh|de|gem-pro|*wiljakumô}}. Cognate to {{cog|nl|welkom}}, {{cog|en|welcome}}, {{cog|da|velkommen}}, and other Germanic forms. Compare also {{cog|fr|bienvenu}}, {{cog|it|benvenuto}}, {{cog|es|bienvenido}}, possibly Germanic calques. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/vɪlˈkɔmən/|[vɪl-]|[ʋɪl-]|[-mən]|[-mn̩]|[-mm̩]}} * {{audio|de|De-willkommen.ogg|Audio}} ===Adjective=== {{head|de|adjective}} # [[welcome]] {{gloss|received with gladness}} #: {{ux|de|Du bist mir immer '''willkommen'''.|You’re always '''welcome''' to my house.}} #: {{ux|de|Das ist eine '''willkommene''' Gelegenheit.|This is a '''welcome''' opportunity.}} ====Usage notes==== * The German word is not used with a following infinitive as in “You are welcome to use my car.” (German: ''Du kannst gern mein Auto nehmen.''). ====Derived terms==== * {{l|de|willkommen heißen}} ===Interjection=== {{head|de|interjection}} # [[welcome]] #: {{ux|de|'''Willkommen''' in Deutschland!|'''Welcome''' to Germany!}} #: {{ux|de|'''Willkommen''' am Bodensee!|'''Welcome''' to Lake Constance!}} #: {{ux|de|'''Willkommen''' auf Helgoland!|'''Welcome''' to Heligoland!}} #: {{ux|de|'''Willkommen''' auf meiner Webseite!|'''Welcome''' to my website!}} #: {{ux|de|'''Willkommen''' bei meinen Eltern!|'''Welcome''' to my parents’ house!}} ====Usage notes==== * As can be seen from the examples above, ''willkommen'' is construed with prepositions of position (not movement) corresponding to the object. Thus, {{m|de|in}} with countries and cities, {{m|de|an}} with bodies of water, {{m|de|bei}} with people, etc., as they are generally used to indicate position. * The preposition {{m|de|zu||to}} may be used with events and activities: ''Willkommen zur Weinprobe!'' (“Welcome to the winetasting!”) However, one may also follow the general rule and use {{m|de|bei}}, {{m|de|auf}}, or whatever preposition of position is appropriate. ====Related terms==== * {{l|de|Willkommen}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}}
